channel.title: How can i make a npc

item.title: How can i make a npc
item.dc:creator: @fedexer -fedexer-
item.description:
@fedexer wrote:

Swat find
all this in NPCHandler.java

find :

} else if (npcs[i].RandomWalk == false && npcs[i].IsUnderAttack == true) {

below it you shall see:

if(npcs[i].npcType == 1645 || npcs[i].npcType == 509 || npcs[i].npcType == 1241 || npcs[i].npcType == 1246) AttackPlayerMage(i); else

just add more id’s to the ones you have

scroll down a few more lines and you will see :

if(npcs[i].StartKilling > 0) { if(npcs[i].npcType == 1645 || npcs[i].npcType == 509 || npcs[i].npcType == 1241 || npcs[i].npcType == 1246)

just add your npc id also into that

hopefully that helps …

Read full topic

item.source: How can i make a npc

item.title: How can i make a npc
item.dc:creator: @fedexer -fedexer-
item.description:
@fedexer wrote:

just one single npc?

in NPCHandler.java find something like :

if(npcs[NPCID].npcType == 1459) { server.playerHandler.players[Play].Guard += 1; }

and then below it you will see more, for a npc to drop one single item, which is always the same then use the example below
EXAMPLE:

if(npcs[NPCID].npcType == 100) { ItemHandler.addItem(*ITEMIDHERE*, npcs[NPCID].absX, npcs[NPCID].absY, 1, GetNpcKiller(NPCID), false); }

well i hope that helps… the 100 is the npc’s id , and the ITEMIDHERE is what you want the npc to drop

Read full topic
